channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Macron, Trump to discuss Ukraine peace plan. And, Greenpeace faces $300 million lawsuit
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to present the European peace plan for Ukraine to President Trump today. And, Greenpeace faces a lawsuit that ...

item.title: Pope critical but 'in good humour' in hospital
item.description: The pontiff is in good humour and eating normally though he remains "critical", Vatican sources say.

item.title: 3 years on, here's what to keep an eye on in the Ukraine war — and efforts to end it

item.title: Federal workers confront mass confusion as Musk’s deadline to list accomplishments looms
item.description: Confusion and chaos loom as hundreds of thousands of federal employees begin their workweek on Monday. They’re facing an 11:59 p.m.

item.title: Roberta Flack, Grammy-winning singer, dies at age 88

item.title: Greenpeace says a pipeline company’s lawsuit threatens the organization’s future
Pennsylvania hostage-taking and shootout highlight rising violence against US hospital workers
American suspected of killing her newborn baby in Paris
item.description: An 18-year-old American student is suspected of throwing her newborn baby out of a third-floor hotel window, Paris prosecution sources told CBS News.

item.title: Macron to warn Trump against looking weak to Putin
item.description: The French president is at the White House to appeal to Trump against rushing into a deal with Russia.

item.title: How "Beyond The Gates" is bringing a fresh approach to daytime drama
item.description: After a 25-year hiatus in new soap launches, the showrunners of "Beyond The Gates" are promising rich storytelling with diverse cast and crew.

item.title: A 10-year-old's story of family immigration that spans three continents

item.title: California cracks down on social media-fueled skincare obsession

item.title: US star John Legend defends playing Rwanda concert during war
item.description: 'We shouldn't punish people when we disagree with their leaders', he told the BBC.

item.title: Pope rests in his 10th day of hospitalization but remains in critical condition
item.description: Francis, 88, had remained in critical condition throughout the weekend after severe breathing difficulties were reported.

item.title: Republicans' love/hate relationship with the Education Department
item.description: President Trump has made clear he wants to close the U.S. Department of Education, but Republicans seem torn on just how far to go.

item.title: Why is Ukraine negotiating a minerals deal with the US?
item.description: A minister says nearly all key details have been finalised for a deal giving the US access to the country's minerals.

item.title: Sudan army ends two-year siege of key city
item.description: The Sudan army captures el-Obeid hours after rival RSF forces signed a charter for a breakaway government.
